title: Fresnillo (OTCMKTS:FNLPF) Reaches New 1-Year High - Still a Buy?
text:
Fresnillo (OTCMKTS:FNLPF) Reaches New 1-Year High - Still a Buy? Written by MarketBeat October 17, 2024 Share Link copied to clipboard. Fresnillo plc ( OTCMKTS:FNLPF - Get Free Report ) shares reached a new 52-week high during trading on Thursday . The stock traded as high as $8.95 and last traded at $8.95, with a volume of 5324 shares changing hands. The stock had previously closed at $8.72. Get Fresnillo alerts: Sign Up Analyst Upgrades and Downgrades
FNLPF has been the topic of several analyst reports. Berenberg Bank upgraded shares of Fresnillo from a "strong sell" rating to a "hold" rating in a report on Friday, July 26th. Canaccord Genuity Group upgraded shares of Fresnillo to a "strong-buy" rating in a research report on Thursday, August 8th.
Read Our Latest Stock Analysis on FNLPF Fresnillo Stock Performance
The business's 50 day moving average price is $7.57 and its 200-day moving average price is $7.45. Fresnillo Company Profile ( Get Free Report )
Fresnillo plc mines, develops, and produces non-ferrous minerals in Mexico. It operates through seven segments: Fresnillo, Saucito, Ciénega, Herradura, Noche Buena, San Julián, and Juanicipio. The company primarily explores for silver, gold, lead, and zinc concentrates. Its projects include the Fresnillo silver mine located in the state of Zacatecas; Saucito silver mine situated in the state of Zacatecas; Ciénega gold mine located in the state of Durango; Herradura gold mine situated in the state of Sonora; Noche Buena gold mine located in the state of Sonora; San Julián silver-gold mine situated on the border of Chihuahua/Durango states; and Juanicipio mine located in the state of Zacatecas.
